_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four truths of the brahmins [an4.185: No sentient beings should be killed
All sensual pleasures are impermanent, suffering, and perishable
All states of existence are impermanent, suffering, and perishable
I don’t belong to anyone anywhere. And nothing belongs to me anywhere.
The qualities of the brahmins [an4.185:7: They speak the truth, not lies
They don’t think of themselves as an ‘ascetic’ or ‘brahmin’ because of that
They don’t think ‘I’m better’ or ‘I’m equal’ or ‘I’m worse’
They simply practice out of kindness and compassion for living creatures, having had insight into the truth of that
They simply practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding sensual pleasures, having had insight into the truth of that
They simply practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding future lives, having had insight into the truth of that
They simply practice the path of nothingness, having had insight into the truth of that.
